optProblem

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • optProblem.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEvent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EvControlPrint, EvDeath, EvEpidemic, EvMove, EvRepr

    public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEvent
    Abstract class for the events
    Author:
    group2

    Abstract class for Events. Has a field for the associated individual and one for the time in which we should execute the event. There are 2 static fields. The first is a Random object to generate random numbers and the other is an Event Comparator that is used when we want to add events to the PEC. Execute Event and toString methods must be overridden.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event(double timee,
             Individual ind)
        Constructor of the Event class. Since Event is abstract this constructor will have to be called from the subclasses using this()
        Parameters:
        timee - is the time of the event
        ind - is the Individual we want to associate with this event. If it's an event with no individual associated then null must be passed as argument.

    • Method Detail

      • ExecEvent

        public abstract void ExecEvent(OptProblem op)
        Abstract method of the event execution. Each event type should redefine this method to do what it should do.
        Specified by:
        ExecEvent in interface IEvent
        Parameters:
        op - is the Optimization Problem that this event belongs to.

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()

        See Also:

      • expRandom

        public static double expRandom(double m)
        Method that returns a random number according to an exponential pdf with mean m. This method doesn't depend on who invokes it so it is static and it will be invoked from the class itself.
        Parameters:
        m - is the mean we want to use in the exponential.
        Returns:
        is the random number generated.
